title.justification: The title of the paper as stated in the provided text.
title.quote: Gupta P, Maharaj T, Weiss M, Rahaman N, Alsdurf H, Minoyan N, et al. (2023) Proactive Contact Tracing.

extractions.description: The paper proposes Proactive Contact Tracing (PCT), which uses multiple sources of information to estimate app users' infectiousness histories and provide behavioral recommendations. It evaluates the Rule-based PCT algorithm and compares it with Binary Contact Tracing (BCT) and Household Quarantine (HQ) using an agent-based model to simulate COVID-19 spread.

type.justification: The paper includes the implementation and testing of an agent-based model to simulate COVID-19 spread and evaluate different contact tracing methods.
type.quote: We evaluate the performance of rule-based PCT, BCT, and HQ scenarios across a range of model parameters that influence user behavior, public health policy, and virological assumptions.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on digital contact tracing techniques using smartphone applications to manage health during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name.quote: Digital contact tracing (DCT) apps have emerged as a component of the epidemic management toolkit.

name.justification: The paper addresses public health measures to control the spread of COVID-19 through innovative digital contact tracing.
name.quote: Public health departments worldwide have, so far, aggressively pursued test-and-trace initiatives to curb viral transmission while relaxing or removing restrictions on social and economic activities.

name.justification: The focus includes the study of disease spread patterns and the impact of interventions like contact tracing on controlling an epidemic.
name.quote: To simulate the spread of COVID-19 virus in a population and generate naturally-occurring phenomena... we implement COVI-AgentSim.

name.justification: The paper introduces the Rule-based PCT as an interpretable instance of the PCT framework.
name.quote: We present an interpretable instance of this framework, the Rule-based PCT algorithm, designed via a multi-disciplinary collaboration among epidemiologists, computer scientists, and behavior experts.

is_contributed.justification: The Rule-based PCT algorithm is a novel concept introduced by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: We proposed a digital contact tracing framework, Proactive Contact Tracing (PCT), which uses multiple sources of information to predict whether a given individual is likely to be infectious on any given day, and recommends appropriately cautious behaviors.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the simulation and evaluation of the Rule-based PCT algorithm.
is_executed.quote: Rule-based PCT is also computationally faster to run, including on legacy smartphones.

is_compared.justification: The Rule-based PCT algorithm is compared with other contact tracing methods like BCT and HQ.
is_compared.quote: Finally, we develop an agent-based model that allows us to compare different DCT methods and evaluate their performance in negotiating the trade-off between epidemic control and restricting population mobility.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Rule-based PCT is a novel contribution by the authors and does not reference another paper as its source.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This is a non-trivial task because the predictions (and corresponding uncertainties) for one user are fed back into the same predictor for other users through risk messages. Research is underway to develop sophisticated deep-learning-based predictors for this purpose, with preliminary findings suggesting unique design and deployment challenges.

name.justification: The dataset is created using the COVI-AgentSim to simulate the spread of COVID-19 and evaluate contact tracing methods.
name.quote: Implement an agent-based model to simulate COVID-19 spread in a population of interest... we implement COVI-AgentSim, a discrete event agent-based model that emulates information propagation.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is newly created by the authors for the purpose of this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our choice of intermediate reduction factors is motivated by simplicity, however, we acknowledge that such reduction factors will likely be influenced by behavior recommendations in these levels, thereby making it crucial to have inputs from PHEs and user behavior experts.

name.justification: The paper mentions that data is collected using a model coded in Python.
name.quote: Data is collected using the ABM that is coded in Python.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no reference to another paper for the Python library; it is commonly used for coding and data collection.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Data is collected using the ABM that is coded in Python.
